title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
summary: The first book in the Harry Potter series, where Harry discovers he is a wizard and attends Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
summary: Bilbo Baggins, a hobbit, embarks on an epic journey to help a group of dwarves reclaim their homeland from the fearsome dragon Smaug.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
summary: Set in the American South during the 1930s, the novel explores racial injustice and moral growth through the eyes of a young girl named Scout Finch.

author: George Orwell
summary: A dystopian novel depicting a totalitarian society, where the government controls every aspect of citizens' lives.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
summary: Set during the Roaring Twenties, the novel explores themes of decadence, idealism, and the American Dream through the life of Jay Gatsby.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
summary: Follows the experiences of a disenchanted teenager named Holden Caulfield in New York City, exploring themes of alienation and identity.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
summary: An epic fantasy trilogy that follows the quest to destroy the One Ring and save Middle-earth from the dark lord Sauron.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
summary: A classic novel exploring themes of love and class in early 19th-century England, focusing on the relationship between Elizabeth Bennet and Mr. Darcy.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
summary: Set in a dystopian future, the novel explores a society where citizens are conditioned for contentment, and individuality is sacrificed for stability.

title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
author: Gabriel García Márquez
summary: A landmark novel blending magical realism and historical fiction, tracing the Buendía family's history in the fictional town of Macondo.
